column4: can someon help me out? im running gutsy and trying to compile a program but keep getting an error saying pkg-config can't find gtk+-2.0.pc file (i have gimp installed and working so i know gtk+ is instaled, and i just installed the dev files) so what am i missing?
you want the second one
clearly it's not installed
pastebin the exact error
hmm what are you building?
any ideas ?
what does this say: pkg-config --exists gtk+-2.0 && echo exists
pkg-config --exists gtk+-2.0 && echo exists doesn't return anything (sorry for delay had anetwork hiccup)
then pkg-config doesn't recognize/see the .pc file
make sure you don't have anything in /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig (particularly not a gtk+-2.0.pc)
gtk+2.0 was in there
you've manually installed gtk for some reason, which is a bad thing
did you do what I said to fix it?
refersh mymemory? tried so much stuff the past few days don't know what ive done anymore lol
you've got an install of gtk in /usr/local that's breaking things
its gone
you have nothing in /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig/ now?
contents of /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig/: atk.pc       gmodule-2.0.pc         gmodule-no-export-2.0.pc  gthread-2.0.pc  libpcre.pc   libpng.pc
you really should get rid of what you have in /usr/local
installing core libraries in /usr/local is bound to cause problems
everything in /usr/local is from stuff you've installed manually
would you recomend i reinstall ubuntu?
